segment.source: How to Recover a Moved Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Moved Drive

segment.source: When you move an operating system drive that has been previously encrypted by using Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), you must resolve certain issues.
segment.target: When you move an operating system drive that has been previously encrypted by using Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), you must resolve certain issues.

segment.source: After a PIN is attached to the new computer, the drive will not accept the start-up PIN that was used in previous computer.
segment.target: After a PIN is attached to the new computer, the drive will not accept the start-up PIN that was used in previous computer.

segment.source: The system considers the PIN to be invalid because of the change to the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip.
segment.target: The system considers the PIN to be invalid because of the change to the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip.

segment.source: You must obtain a recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password in order to use the moved drive.
segment.target: You must obtain a recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password in order to use the moved drive.

segment.source: To do this, use the following procedure.
segment.target: To do this, use the following procedure.

segment.source: To recover a moved drive
segment.target: To recover a moved drive

segment.source: On the computer that contains the moved drive, start in Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) mode, or start the computer by using the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT).
segment.target: On the computer that contains the moved drive, start in Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) mode, or start the computer by using the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT).

segment.source: Once the computer has been started with WinRE or DaRT, MBAM will treat the moved operating system drive as a data drive.
segment.target: Once the computer has been started with WinRE or DaRT, MBAM will treat the moved operating system drive as a data drive.

segment.source: MBAM will then display the drive’s recovery password ID and ask for the recovery password.
segment.target: MBAM will then display the drive’s recovery password ID and ask for the recovery password.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In some cases, you might be able to click I forget the PIN during the startup process to enter the recovery mode.
segment.target: In some cases, you might be able to click I forget the PIN during the startup process to enter the recovery mode.

segment.source: This also displays the recovery key ID.
segment.target: This also displays the recovery key ID.

segment.source: On the MBAM administration website, use the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password and unlock the drive.
segment.target: On the MBAM administration website, use the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password and unlock the drive.

segment.source: If the moved drive was configured to use a TPM chip on the original computer, you must take additional steps after you unlock the drive and complete the start process.
segment.target: If the moved drive was configured to use a TPM chip on the original computer, you must take additional steps after you unlock the drive and complete the start process.

segment.source: In WinRE mode, open a command prompt and use the manage-bde tool to decrypt the drive.
segment.target: In WinRE mode, open a command prompt and use the manage-bde tool to decrypt the drive.

segment.source: The use of this tool is the only way to remove the TPM-plus-PIN protection without the original TPM chip.
segment.target: The use of this tool is the only way to remove the TPM-plus-PIN protection without the original TPM chip.

segment.source: After the removal is complete, start the system normally.
segment.target: After the removal is complete, start the system normally.

segment.source: The MBAM agent will proceed to enforce the policy to encrypt the drive with the new computer’s TPM plus PIN.
segment.target: The MBAM agent will proceed to enforce the policy to encrypt the drive with the new computer’s TPM plus PIN.
